configuration.name: widget_09216004639951692
configuration.stem: Arrange the statements in the order they occur when an animal responds to a stimulus in its environment.

feedBack.firstWrongHint: Trace the path of a stimulus, such as a odor or sound, to the brain of the animal. Think about how the animal might respond.
feedBack.finalWrongHint: Messages from the environment are detected by sensory receptors on an animal's body. The sensory receptors send messages to the brain, which in turn sends messages back out to the animal's body to launch a response.

options.ddoText: The sensory receptor sends a message to the animal's brain along a sensory path.
The brain sends messages back to parts of the animal's body via the nervous system.
A stimulus is detected by a sensory receptor on the animal's body.
The animal responds to the stimulus with a behavior.
